Team4450.Lib

Class NavX

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team4450.Lib.NavX

  • public class NavX
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class for NavX MXP navigation sensor board.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NavX.PinType
      Specifies pin type when accessing NavX pins.
      static class  NavX.PortType
      Identifies port the NavX is plugged into

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static NavX getInstance()
        Return global instance of NavX object. First call creates the NavX global object and starts the calibration process. Calibration can take up 10 seconds. Uses SPI PortType to access the NavX.
        Returns:
        NavX object reference.

      • getInstance

        public static NavX getInstance(NavX.PortType portType)
        Return global instance of NavX object. First call creates the NavX global object and starts the calibration process. Calibration can take up 10 seconds.
        Parameters:
        portType - Specify the interface port to be used to access the NavX.
        Returns:
        NavX object reference.

      • getAHRS

        public com.kauailabs.navx.frc.AHRS getAHRS()
        Return global instance of NavX AHRS object. AHRS is Attitude/Heading Reference System. AHRS object is the NavX library and provides access to all NavX methods and properties.
        Returns:
        AHRS object reference.

      • getYaw

        public float getYaw()
        Return yaw angle from zero point, which is direction robot was pointing when resetYaw() last called. Uses Navx internal function which is updated on a timed basis (update rate). There can be a delay between calling zeroYaw() and getting a zero returned from getYaw(), as much as 150ms.
        Returns:
        Yaw angle in degrees -179 to +179, - is left of zero, + is right.

      • getTotalYaw

        public double getTotalYaw()
        Return total yaw angle accumulated since last reset.
        Returns:
        Total yaw angle in degrees.

      • getHeadingYaw

        public double getHeadingYaw()
        Returns Yaw angle between target heading set by setTargetHeading() and the current robot heading.
        Returns:
        Yaw angle (0-180), - is yaw left of target heading, + is yaw right of target.

      • getYawRate

        public double getYawRate()
        Return yaw rate.
        Returns:
        Yaw rate in degrees/second.

      • getHeading

        public double getHeading()
        Return current robot heading (0-359.n) relative to direction robot was pointed at last heading reset (setHeading). Will return fractional angle. 1 degree is right of zero (clockwise) and 359 is left (counter clockwise).
        Returns:
        Robot heading in degrees.

      • getHeadingR

        public double getHeadingR()
        Return current robot heading (0-359.n) relative to direction robot was pointed at last heading reset (setHeading). Will return fractional angle. 1 degree is left of zero (count clockwise) and 359 is right (clockwise). This is how headings are done when working with radians.
        Returns:
        Robot heading in degrees.

      • getHeadingInt

        public int getHeadingInt()
        Return current robot heading (0-359) relative to direction robot was pointed at last heading reset (setHeading).
        Returns:
        Robot heading in whole degrees.

      • getHeadingIntR

        public int getHeadingIntR()
        Return current robot heading (0-359) relative to direction robot was pointed at last heading reset (setHeading). Radians format.
        Returns:
        Robot heading in whole degrees.

      • setHeading

        public void setHeading(double offset)
        Set heading tracking angle to offset value.
        Parameters:
        offset - Offset from 0-359 that is used to adjust the heading to the direction the robot is pointing relative to the direction the driver is looking. Typically called at the start of autonomous per the starting direction of the robot. 0 degrees is always straight down the field.

      • setTargetHeading

        public void setTargetHeading(double heading)
        Set target heading for yaw measured from current heading.
        Parameters:
        heading - Target heading 0-359. Cannot be more than 180 degrees from robot current heading.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns connected state of NavX device.
        Returns:
        True if connected.

      • isCalibrating

        public boolean isCalibrating()
        Returns calibrating state of Navx device.
        Returns:
        True if calibrating.

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Return moving state of NavX device.
        Returns:
        True if moving.

      • isRotating

        public boolean isRotating()
        Return rotating state of NavX device.
        Returns:
        True if rotating.

      • resetYaw

        public void resetYaw()
        Reset yaw zero reference to current direction the robot is pointing. getYaw may not return zero immediately after calling this function as zeroYaw takes a varying amount of time to be reflected in getYaw return. Manufacturer suggests it could be up to 150ms but we have observed 300ms in some cases.

      • resetYawWait

        public void resetYawWait()
        Reset yaw zero reference to current direction the robot is pointing and wait for reset to complete. Set wait time with setYawResetWait(). Defaults to 175ms.

      • resetYawWait

        public void resetYawWait(double wait)
        Reset yaw zero reference to current direction the robot is pointing and wait the specified time for reset to complete.
        Parameters:
        wait - Wait time in milliseconds (0-2000).

      • setYawResetWait

        public void setYawResetWait(double wait)
        Set yaw reset wait time.
        Parameters:
        wait - Wait time in milliseconds (0-2000).

      • resetYawWait

        public void resetYawWait(double tolerance,
                         int wait)
        Reset yaw zero reference to current direction the robot is pointing and wait for reset to complete. Wait is determined by watching getYaw to return a value 0..tolerance (degrees). Checked every 10ms or until wait max is reached.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - Tolerance (degrees) to determine reset complete (0-10).
        wait - Number of milliseconds to wait (10, 5000-10ms resolution).

      • getChannelFromPin

        public int getChannelFromPin(NavX.PinType type,
                             int io_pin_number)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return RoboRio channel number for a NavX pin. Not for NavX-Mini.
        Parameters:
        type - PinType of pin to get channel for.
        io_pin_number - Pin number to get channel for.
        Returns:
        RoboRio channel number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • dumpValuesToNetworkTables

        public void dumpValuesToNetworkTables()
        Dump all NavX AHRS properties current values to Network Tables for debugging.
